            <l>Killing, [kniving?], going to bed, adultery must still</l>
            <l>be the staple of the play; but the staple of</l>
            <l>of the <del>play</del> is    the <del>staple</del> there must be</l>
            <l>action; murder; violence; adultery. But by degrees</l>
            <l>the dramatist is freeing himself from the stage.</l>
            <l>He is adding to his resources. There are</l>

          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And by degrees the dramatist sheds his</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">anonymity. He separates himself from his audience.</l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l>He wins <del>a</del> freedom. <del>Though the stage exacts</del></l>
            <l><del>with an</del> in an <del>ande</del> <del>in the</del> to</l>
          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>He</del> He wins the right sometimes to fame, in an</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.], sometimes to divert the mind from what</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">happens, to the motives, <del>the hidden passions.</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">behind the action. What, he broods, in a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">effect of mercy? – if, the sword is withheld</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">if the adulterers are [empouted?] not with death,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but with a guilty conscience? –</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>its <del>drag</del> <del>its</del> <add place="above">the</add> compulsion of <del>what</del> the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>of the plot. It still.</del> But <del> here the reader</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>at some such point the reader is born:</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the <del>close co</del> <del>actors</del> dramatists close</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>companion; <del>the</del> <del>detached</del> the reader, the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>human being who writes</del>    So by degrees,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the reader too loses anonymity. The</l>
